gw.api.assignment

Class AssignmentPopup

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.assignment.AssignmentPopup

  • public class AssignmentPopup
extends java.lang.Object
    Support for assignment popup screen, used to assign a list of assignables to a user, group, queue or other assignee (for example, auto assignment). This screen makes use of an internal AssigneePicker to keep track of the assignment search results, which could be a user, group or queue.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      IEntityType AssignableType
      The type of entity being assigned by this popup.
      Assignable[] FailedAssignables
      Returns a list of assignables that could not be assigned when performAssignment was called. These assignables can be displayed to the user so they know which assignments failed. Returns an empty array if there were no failures or if performAssignment has not been called.
      AssigneePicker Picker
      The assignee picker, used to store the status of any searches the User uses to find an assignee. If the selection type is "FromSearch" then the picker's current selection will be used as the chosen assignee.
      static java.lang.String SYMBOL_NAME
      Usual symbol name for the assignment popup object
      java.lang.String SelectFromSearchLabel
      Return a label describing the user's options for searching for an assignee. This label may differ for different types of assignables. For example not all assignables can be assigned to a queue so the label will only mention the option of searching for a queue if it is actually available.
      Assignee SelectedFromList
      Get the assignee chosen from the suggested assignee list, if any. This will be used as the chosen assignee if the selection type is "FromList".
      AssignmentSelectionType SelectionType
      Returns either "FromList" (if one of the suggested assignees was chosen) or "FromSearch" (if the user searched for an assignee).
      Assignee[] SuggestedAssignees
      The list of suggested assignees generated by the suggested assignee builder.

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AssignmentPopup(IEntityType assignableType, Assignable[] assignables, SuggestedAssigneeBuilder suggestedAssigneeBuilder)
      Creates a new assignment popup for the given assignables of the given assignable type. Uses the provided suggestedAssigneeBuilder to generate an initial list of likely assignees. The first suggested assignee is picked by default.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasErrors()
      Were there errors when performAssignment was called.
      boolean performAssignment()
      Performs assignment to the chosen assignee, as specified by the current selection type and either the SelectedFromList property (if selection type is "FromList") or the AssigneePicker.Selection (if selection type is "FromSearch"). This operation tries to assign multiple assignables to the chosen assignee. Each assignment is done separately and can succeed or fail without affecting the other assignments. For each failure an error will be added to the current locations error list and the assignable will be added to the FailedAssignables list. If there are no failures, returns true. If there are failures throws UserDisplayableException
      void setSelectedFromList(Assignee selectedFromList)
      Set the assignee chosen from the suggested assignee list. This will be used as the chosen assignee if the selection type is "FromList".
      void setSelectionType(AssignmentSelectionType selectionType)
      Set the selection type to either "FromList" (if one of the suggested assignees was chosen) or "FromSearch" (if the user searched for an assignee).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • AssignableType

        IEntityType AssignableType
        The type of entity being assigned by this popup.

      • FailedAssignables

        Assignable[] FailedAssignables
        Returns a list of assignables that could not be assigned when performAssignment was called. These assignables can be displayed to the user so they know which assignments failed. Returns an empty array if there were no failures or if performAssignment has not been called.

      • Picker

        AssigneePicker Picker
        The assignee picker, used to store the status of any searches the User uses to find an assignee. If the selection type is "FromSearch" then the picker's current selection will be used as the chosen assignee.

      • SelectFromSearchLabel

        java.lang.String SelectFromSearchLabel
        Return a label describing the user's options for searching for an assignee. This label may differ for different types of assignables. For example not all assignables can be assigned to a queue so the label will only mention the option of searching for a queue if it is actually available.

      • SelectedFromList

        Assignee SelectedFromList
        Get the assignee chosen from the suggested assignee list, if any. This will be used as the chosen assignee if the selection type is "FromList".

      • SelectionType

        AssignmentSelectionType SelectionType
        Returns either "FromList" (if one of the suggested assignees was chosen) or "FromSearch" (if the user searched for an assignee).

      • SuggestedAssignees

        Assignee[] SuggestedAssignees
        The list of suggested assignees generated by the suggested assignee builder.

      • SYMBOL_NAME

        java.lang.String SYMBOL_NAME
        Usual symbol name for the assignment popup object

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssignmentPopup

        AssignmentPopup(IEntityType assignableType,
               Assignable[] assignables,
               SuggestedAssigneeBuilder suggestedAssigneeBuilder)
        Creates a new assignment popup for the given assignables of the given assignable type. Uses the provided suggestedAssigneeBuilder to generate an initial list of likely assignees. The first suggested assignee is picked by default.
        Parameters:
        assignableType - the type of the assignable entities to be assigned
        assignables - the entities to be assigned
        suggestedAssigneeBuilder - builder that returns a list of likely assignees to be suggested to the user. The user will be able to search for other assignees if the one they want is not in this suggested list.

    • Method Detail

      • hasErrors

        boolean hasErrors()
        Were there errors when performAssignment was called.
        Returns:
        true if there are errors

      • performAssignment

        boolean performAssignment()
        Performs assignment to the chosen assignee, as specified by the current selection type and either the SelectedFromList property (if selection type is "FromList") or the AssigneePicker.Selection (if selection type is "FromSearch"). This operation tries to assign multiple assignables to the chosen assignee. Each assignment is done separately and can succeed or fail without affecting the other assignments. For each failure an error will be added to the current locations error list and the assignable will be added to the FailedAssignables list.

        If there are no failures, returns true. If there are failures throws UserDisplayableException

        Returns:
        true if assignment was successful

      • setSelectedFromList

        void setSelectedFromList(Assignee selectedFromList)
        Set the assignee chosen from the suggested assignee list. This will be used as the chosen assignee if the selection type is "FromList".
        Parameters:
        selectedFromList - selected assignee

      • setSelectionType

        void setSelectionType(AssignmentSelectionType selectionType)
        Set the selection type to either "FromList" (if one of the suggested assignees was chosen) or "FromSearch" (if the user searched for an assignee).
        Parameters:
        selectionType - assignment selection type
